body_html: torch.norm() already gives you the frobenius norm of a matrix since it vectorizes the input and then computes the l2-norm. Other than that, I agree that it would be nice to have a scipy/numpy like implementation of induced operator norms.
body_text: torch.norm() already gives you the frobenius norm of a matrix since it vectorizes the input and then computes the l2-norm. Other than that, I agree that it would be nice to have a scipy/numpy like implementation of induced operator norms.
body: torch.norm() already gives you the frobenius norm of a matrix since it vectorizes the input and then computes the l2-norm. Other than that, I agree that it would be nice to have a scipy/numpy like implementation of induced operator norms.
